definition: uncle/father's younger brother/husband's younger brother/Taiwan pr. [shu2]
root/stem/origin/source/this/the current/original/inherent/originally/classifier for books, periodicals, files etc
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua

sentences.english: I think the man tried to make some kind of connection with Schopenhauer.
sentences.chinese: 我想這個男的試着想要扯上叔本華。

sentences.english: The philosophy and aesthetics of Wang Guo-wei are deeply effected by Schopenhauer.
sentences.chinese: 王國維的哲學和美學思想深受叔本華的影響。

sentences.english: Nietzsches will to power stems from Schopenhauer s Survival Will.
sentences.chinese: 尼采的權力意志論源於叔本華的生存意志論。

sentences.english: Schopenhauer continued to search for love but with ever less success.
sentences.chinese: 叔本華繼續尋覓他的愛，可運氣更不如前。

sentences.english: " Schopenhauer called this "will, " but his physician diagnosed it as hay fever.
sentences.chinese: 叔本華稱之爲“意志”，不過他的醫生診斷是乾草熱。

sentences.english: Schopenhauer's tragedy theory did not differentiate the evil and the good.
sentences.chinese: 叔本華的悲劇理論是沒有善惡分別的。

sentences.english: Schopenhauer's irrationalistic philosophy and aesthetic thinking have great influence on later generations.
sentences.chinese: 叔本華的非理性主義哲學和美學思想對後世影響很大。

sentences.english: The third chapter mainly discusses Schopenhauer's study about human behaviour motivations.
sentences.chinese: 第三章主要論述了叔本華對人類行爲動機的研究。

sentences.english: The second chapter discusses Schopenhauer's criticism of Kant's ethics.
sentences.chinese: 第二章主要論述了叔本華的道德哲學理論。

sentences.english: I think it's Plato, Schopenhauer, Satre and Singer.
sentences.chinese: 是柏拉圖，叔本華，薩特和辛格。

sentences.english: During the 19th Century, the philosophic theories of Schopenhauer and Wikipedin prevailed.
sentences.chinese: 公元19世紀，叔本華與尼采的哲學理論盛行於世。

definition: lit. a notch on the side of a boat to locate a sword dropped overboard (idiom); fig. an action made pointless by changed circumstances

the Book of History, one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1], a compendium of documents which make up the oldest extant texts of Chinese history, from legendary times down to the time of Confucius, also known as 尚書經|尚书经[Shang4 shu1 jing1], 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], 書|书[Shu1]
Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (1770-1831), German philosopher
lit. view a text and interpret (idiom); to interpret word by word without understanding the meaning/a far-fetched interpretation
Das Kapital (1867) by Karl Marx 卡爾·馬克思|卡尔·马克思[Ka3 er3 · Ma3 ke4 si1]
scholars tend to disparage one another (idiom)
